required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of T.R.U.E. TEST in Children and Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of T.R.U.E. TESTÂ® Panel 1.1, 2.1 and 3.1: in Children and Adolescents

brief_summary.textblock: Open, prospective, single-site, non-randomized study of the efficacy and safety of T.R.U.E. TEST allergens in children and adolescents ages 6-18.

detailed_description.textblock: Three T.R.U.E. TEST panels (1.1, 2.1 and 3.1) containing 28 allergens and a negative control will be applied to the skin on the subject's back and worn for approximately 48 hours. Patch test site skin reactions will be evaluated at days 2, 3 (+1), 7 and 21 following panel application

Panel Adhesion was evaluated according to the following score scale: Off: Test panel fell off, Poor: little to no skin to panel contact, Fair: skin to panel contact variable, tape edges lifting, Good: skin contact acceptable, some tape edges loose; Excellent, skin contact good, tape edges adherent.
Panel Irritation was scored according to the following descriptors; None, Weak, Moderate, Strong (not defined in protocol)
Subject reported itching/burning was scored according to the following descriptors; None, Weak, Moderate, Strong (not defined in protocol)

arm_group.description: All subjects were patched with 3 T.R.U.E. Test panels containing 28 allergens and 1 negative control.

intervention.description: 48 hour application of 28 allergens and negative control

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Symptoms and history potentially consistent with allergic contact dermatitis based on symptoms and clinical history (i.e., subjects are visiting the clinic/physician to diagnose, treat or resolve this condition).
- Children and adolescents 6 to 18 years of age, and in general good health.
- Adolescent females 15 years of age or older (or with menarche) must consent to a urine pregnancy test; urine test results must be negative for study inclusion.
- Informed consent must be signed and understood by subject. If underage, informed consent must be signed and understood by parent or legal guardian, consistent with all institutional, local and national regulations.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Topical corticosteroid treatment during the last 7 days on or near the test area.
- Systemic treatment with corticosteroids or other immunosuppressive during the last 7 days.
- Subjects currently receiving (or received during the previous 3 weeks) other investigational drugs, treatments or devices, or participating in another clinical study.
- Treatment with ultraviolet (UV) light (including tanning) during the previous 3 weeks.
- Acute dermatitis outbreak or dermatitis on or near the test area on the back.
- Subjects unable to comply with activity restrictions (e.g., protecting test panels from excess moisture due to showering or vigorous activity).
- Subjects unable or unwilling to comply with multiple return visits.
- Female subjects 15 years of age (or with onset of menarche) and older unable to consent to a urine pregnancy test, or those with a positive pregnancy test.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Single Site- Rady Children's Hospital Recruiting Period-09 December 2008 (first subject enrolled) 27 October 2009 (last subject exited)

group.title: Single Arm Study
group.description: All subjects were patched with TRUE Test panels 1.1, 2.1 and 3.1

outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed includes all subjects who completed the study.

outcome.title: Panel Adhesion Evaluation
outcome.description: Panel Adhesion was evaluated according to the following score scale: Off: Test panel fell off, Poor: little to no skin to panel contact, Fair: skin to panel contact variable, tape edges lifting, Good: skin contact acceptable, some tape edges loose; Excellent, skin contact good, tape edges adherent.
outcome.time_frame: Visit 2 (day 1) prior to panel removal.
outcome.population: All subjects who completed the study are included in the analysis.

measure.title: Panel Adhesion Evaluation
measure.description: Panel Adhesion was evaluated according to the following score scale: Off: Test panel fell off, Poor: little to no skin to panel contact, Fair: skin to panel contact variable, tape edges lifting, Good: skin contact acceptable, some tape edges loose; Excellent, skin contact good, tape edges adherent.
measure.population: All subjects who completed the study are included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Panel Irritation
outcome.description: Panel Irritation was scored according to the following descriptors; None, Weak, Moderate, Strong (not defined in protocol)
outcome.time_frame: Visit 2 (day 1) following to panel removal.
outcome.population: All subjects who completed the study are included in the analysis.

measure.title: Panel Irritation
measure.description: Panel Irritation was scored according to the following descriptors; None, Weak, Moderate, Strong (not defined in protocol)
measure.population: All subjects who completed the study are included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Subject Reported Itching and Burning
outcome.description: Subject reported itching/burning was scored according to the following descriptors; None, Weak, Moderate, Strong (not defined in protocol)
outcome.time_frame: Visit 2 (day 1) following to panel removal.
outcome.population: All subjects who completed the study are included in the analysis.

measure.title: Subject Reported Itching and Burning
measure.description: Subject reported itching/burning was scored according to the following descriptors; None, Weak, Moderate, Strong (not defined in protocol)
measure.population: All subjects who completed the study are included in the analysis.

reported_events.time_frame: The Adverse Event-Reporting Period for each study subject began at application of the patch test and ended with the Day 21 visit.

event.sub_title: Slight worsening of spot on leg

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
